rest.server.httpHandler

Interface WalletServer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WalletServerResources

    @Path(value="/wallet")
public interface WalletServer
    Wallet Server API

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClientResponse generateMoney(javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, ClientAddMoneyRequest cliRequest)
      Generates money for a user Request must me made from a admin account.
      ClientResponse getAmount(javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, java.lang.String userIdentifier, java.lang.String signature)
      Gets current balance of a user
      ClientResponse listUsers(javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
      List all users and its balances.
      ClientResponse transferMoney(javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, ClientTransferRequest cliRequest)
      Transfers money from one user to another

    • Method Detail

      • listUsers

        @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
ClientResponse listUsers(@Context
                                                                   javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
        List all users and its balances. It does not goes to a consensus, for debug purposes only
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of request (nonce)
        Returns:
        Client response with all users and balances and no replica reesponses

      • getAmount

        @GET
 @Path(value="/{userIdentifier}")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
ClientResponse getAmount(@Context
                                                                                                     javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                                                                                     @PathParam(value="userIdentifier")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String userIdentifier,
                                                                                                     @QueryParam(value="signature")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String signature)
        Gets current balance of a user
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of the request
        userIdentifier - User to get the balance
        signature - Signature of the request
        Returns:
        Client response with the balance of the user with all replica responses

      • generateMoney

        @POST
 @Path(value="/create")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
ClientResponse generateMoney(@Context
                                                                                                                                       javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                                                                                                                       ClientAddMoneyRequest cliRequest)
        Generates money for a user Request must me made from a admin account.
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of request (nonce)
        cliRequest - Client request with the amount to be generated and the user that will get the money
        Returns:
        Client response with the new balance of the user and with all replica responses

      • transferMoney

        @POST
 @Path(value="/transfer")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
ClientResponse transferMoney(@Context
                                                                                                                                       javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                                                                                                                       ClientTransferRequest cliRequest)
        Transfers money from one user to another
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers of request (nonce)
        cliRequest - Client request with the amount to be transferred, the source and destination users
        Returns:
        Client response with the new balance of the source user and with all replica responses
